Christina Grimmie’s Family Accept Award on Her Behalf at Humane Society Gala

by 0 Shares

Advertisement

Christina Grimmie’s family is honoring their daughter’s life nearly a year after her devastating death. The former Voice contestant was recognized at the Humane Society’s annual To The Rescue! benefit in Los Angeles over the weekend.

Her family was moved to tears when they accepted the Impact Award on her behalf during the ceremony.

Rachel Platten performed “Fight Song” as a tribute to the 22-year-old while an emotional video montage played in the background.

Her mother and father, Tina and Bud Grimmie, and her brother, Marcus Grimmie, all went on stage to speak on Christina’s behalf and talk about her love of animals.

"Christina loved the Humane Society, she loved the rescue, she loved animals," Tina told E! News.

The singer’s close friend Sarah Luebkemann also attended the event and posted an emotional message to Instagram afterwards. "Got all dolled up for the @humanesociety gala tonight where they were not only honoring Christina for the simply incredible human she is, but celebrating her for the passion and heart that she poured into supporting their cause," she wrote.

A post shared by S a r a h R y l y n n (@happlesful) on Apr 22, 2017 at 9:33pm PDT

"It was simply beautiful. Lots of tears and hugs. I've so enjoyed getting to know the people and causes Christina was pouring her heart into the last several years. And finally got to meet the very sweet @rachelplatten,” she continued. "Christina toured with her last year and she absolutely loved Rachel. Rachel, thank you for being so kind and genuine, and for loving on & encouraging Christina.”

The YouTube star was shot to death in Orlando, Florida following her concert last June. She passed away in a hospital just a few hours later. What an emotional night. We know Christina will never be forgotten!
